intro: Pimpinella trifurcata, commonly known as the three-branch parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like carrots and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It is often grown for its ornamental value and mild, parsley-like aroma. Pimpinella trifurcata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
